doc.after: In January 2009 the Transport Secretary Geoff Hoon announced that the UK government supported the expansion of Heathrow by building a third 2,200-metre (7,200Â ft) runway and a sixth terminal building.[130] This decision followed the 2003 white paper on the future of air transport in the UK,[131] and a public consultation in November 2007.[132] This was a controversial decision which met with widespread opposition because of the expected greenhouse gas emissions, impact on local communities, as well as noise and air pollution concerns.
